content.raw: Just for future reference, to attach a mesh to a visual, now we have to `InsertMesh` -> `AttachMesh`? And these meshes must have been previously created by `common::MeshManager`?
content.html: Just for future reference, to attach a mesh to a visual, now we have to InsertMesh -> AttachMesh? And these meshes must have been previously created by common::MeshManager?

content.raw: I think it should work with just `AttachMesh` since it also calls `InsertMesh`. The API can be improved a little. I don't know if we need to expose `InsertMesh` at all. Something to think about later.
content.html: I think it should work with just AttachMesh since it also calls InsertMesh. The API can be improved a little. I don't know if we need to expose InsertMesh at all. Something to think about later.

content.raw: So it looks like all the classes which inherit from `rendering::Visual` will now have a `VisualPtr` member within them, correct?
content.html: So it looks like all the classes which inherit from rendering::Visual will now have a VisualPtr member within them, correct?

content.raw: not necessarily. You can attach an object directly to *Visual classes and it'll be positioned at the center of the visual, but we tend to use child visuals so we can give them an offset pose.
content.html: not necessarily. You can attach an object directly to *Visual classes and it'll be positioned at the center of the visual, but we tend to use child visuals so we can give them an offset pose.
